stems.BSC: (to be) a degree of a (static) dimensional attribute (e.g., length, width, volume, etc.)
stems.CTE: (to be) the intrinsic nature/essence of a particular attribute (i.e., the existence of the attribute within or as part of an entity regardless of its physical manifestation
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical manifestation of a particular dimensional attribute
stems.OBJ: (to be) the object/entity having the particular dimensional attribute

stems: (to be) a decrease in the degree of a particular dimensional attribute
(to be) an increase in the degree of a particular dimensional attribute
notes: use with the SUF, EXD, FLC, PTW, ITY, etc. affixes

refers: PLANARITY/FLATNESS RELATIVE TO THE FORM OF AN OBJECT ITSELF
notes: i.e., the extent to which all the points of a surface are parallel to each other in the dimensional context of the surface itself, such as the surface of a blanket (regardless of whether it is folded or laid flat) or the surface of a sphere (where the sphere’s surface can be considered flat/planar from the perspective of the surface itself, regardless of the fact the sphere as a whole is not
i.e., the linear distance between the two points furthest from each other on a cross-sectional plane through an object
i.e., the longest spatial dimension of an object/entity
= TALLNESS PARALLEL TO THE DIRECTION OF GRAVITY
i.e., the degree to which something reverses direction of a binary attribute, e.g., rotation, spin, charge, etc.
i.e., the degree to which something extends outward in a quasi-linear manner
i.e., the degree to which something extends outward in 2-dimensional quasi-planar coverage
i.e., the degree to which something extends outward as a three-dimensional volume
i.e., the shortest spatial dimension of an object/entity
i.e., ratio of shortest dimensional end-to-end axis-length to next longest dimensional end-to-end axis-length
i.e., the elapsed time/duration between two events/occurrences/states
i.e., the extent to which a surface is spheroidally curved from an external perspective
i.e., the extent to which the points of a surface constitute a flat plane from an external perspective

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of spatio-temporal extension linearly/unidimensionally (up/out/along/back, etc.) to a certain point/level/height, etc.; to extend in such a manner, to“reach” (to) a certain point/level/height, etc.
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of extension / being extended unidimensionally
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of spatio-temporal extension unidimensionally
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which spatio-temporally extends or “reaches” unidimensionally to a particular point/level/height, etc.

stems: (to be) a state of extension two-dimensionally (out/among/away, etc.) to a certain distance/edge/linear landmark/linear boundary, etc., “reach” (to) a certain

(to be) a state of spatio-temporal extension three-dimensionally (out/among/away, etc.) to a certain distance/planar edge/planar landmark/planar boundary, etc., “reach” (to) a certain distance/planar edge/planar landmark/planar boundary, etc.; to extend/ “reach” three-dimensionally in such a manner

stems.BSC: (to be in) a position at/on a particular planar level of a vertically sequential series of levels; to be positioned on a particular level (of a vertically sequential series of levels)
stems.CTE: (to be) in a state of being on a particular physical level of a vertically sequential series of levels
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of physically positioning oneself or being positioned on a particular level
stems.OBJ: (to be) the particular physical level something or someone is positioned on

stems: (to be in) a position on a particular floor/story of a building (e.g., be on the fifth floor/story of a hotel); be on a particular floor/story of a building
(to be in) a position on a particular abstract level/tier of a series of metaphorical/abstract tiers/levels of something (e.g., ‘He plays at grandmaster level/tier when it comes to chess.’)

stems.BSC: (to be in) a position in a particular linear/planar row of a horizontally sequential series of rows; to be positioned in a particular row (of a horizontally sequential series of rows) [as viewed externally from the row]
stems.CTE: (to be) in a state of being in a particular physical row of a horizontally sequential series of row
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of physically positioning oneself or being positioned on a particular row
stems.OBJ: (to be) the particular physical row something or someone is placed/positioned in

stems: (to be in) a position in a particular linear/planar rank/file/line of a sequential series of front-to-back ranks/files/line; to be positioned in a particular rank/file (of a sequential series of front-to-back ranks/files) [as viewed externally]
(to be in) a position in a queue; to be (lined up) in a queue

stems.BSC: (to be in) a position in a particular linear vertical column of a sequential series of horizontally-aligned columns; to be positioned oin a particular vertical column (of a sequential series of horizontally-aligned columns)
stems.CTE: (to be) in a state of being in a particular physical vertical column of a sequential series of horizontally-aligned columns
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of physically positioning oneself or being positioned in a particular physical vertical column of a sequential series of horizontally-aligned columns
stems.OBJ: (to be) the particular physical column something or someone is positioned in

stems: (to be in) a position in a particular linear vertical column of a sequential series of front-to-back-aligned columns; to be positioned oin a particular vertical column (of a sequential series of front-to-back-aligned columns)
(to be in) a position in a vertical column (i.e., a vertical/columnar queue)

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act/instance of arranging or b
stems.CTE: (to be) a particular arrangement or pattern
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/process of physically placing entities into an arrangement or pattern
stems.OBJ: (to be) an entity in or part of a particular arrangement or pattern

stems: (to be) a an act/state/instance of arranging/ordering or being arranged/ordered based on a specific criterion or criteria
(to be) an act/instance of symmetrical arrangement; to arrange symmetrically
notes:
Affix: **CLS**

MORPHOLOGICAL DERIVATIVES: array, setting, hierarchy, symmetry, disarray, scatter, mess, chaos

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act/instance of being/making regular or displaying regularity (i.e., having an expected/conventionalized/predictable pattern); be/make regular, regularize
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being regular
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/process of making something regular; to regularize
stems.OBJ: (to be) something that is in a state of being regular or having been regularized

stems: (to be) a state/act/instance of being in or making a classification (i.e., an arranged scheme for storage-and-retrieval); to classify
(to be) a state/act/instance of being in or making an assortment (i.e., an arranged selection of members/components); to sort
